page.title: 05Noke
page.content: This village,about two miles SE of Islip,is strung out along a side road which ends abruptly on the edge of Otmoor.There are two farms,a pub called the Plough,a small church,and a pie factory in one of the farm buildings.There is a good playing field and sports pavilion,and a small garden centre in the grounds of the school which was closed many years ago and is now a private house. An old rhyme believed to date from the Otmoor riots starts like this: I went to Noke and nobody spoke and ends like this: But when I went to Beckley There they spoke directly No indication is given of allegiances. Some sources attribute this rhyme to the Civil War period.
